it.emarolab.owloop.core

Interface Concept.Equivalent<O,J,D extends Concept<O,J>>

  • Type Parameters:
    O - the type of ontology in which the axioms for classes will be applied.
    J - the type of the described class. (it represents also the of Semantic.Axioms managed by this Descriptor.
    D - the type of the Concept descriptor instantiated during buildEquivalentConcept() through getNewEquivalentConcept(Object, Object).
    All Superinterfaces:
    Concept<O,J>, Semantic, Semantic.Descriptor<O,J>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MORConcept.Equivalent<D>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MORDefinitionConcept, MORFullConcept
    Enclosing interface:
    Concept<O,J>

    public static interface Concept.Equivalent<O,J,D extends Concept<O,J>>
extends Concept<O,J>
    The Semantic.Descriptor for equivalent classes of an ontological class.

    This Semantic.Descriptor synchronises the equivalent classes of a specific class (i.e.: the Ground#getGroundInstance()).

    File: it.emarolab.owloop.core.Concept
    Licence: GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE. Version 3, 29 June 2007
    Author: Buoncompagni Luca (luca.buoncompagni@edu.unige.it)
    affiliation: EMAROLab, DIBRIS, University of Genoa.
    date: 21/05/17

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default java.util.Set<D> buildEquivalentConcept()
      Create an Semantic.Descriptor set where each element represents the classes equivalent to this Concept.
      Semantic.Axioms<J> getEquivalentConcept()
      Returns the Semantic.Axioms that describes all the equivalent classes of this Concept from a no OOP point of view.
      D getNewEquivalentConcept(J instance, O ontology)
      This method is called by buildEquivalentConcept() and its purpose is to instantiate a new Concept to represent an class equivalent from this Concept Descriptor.
      Semantic.Axioms<J> queryEquivalentConcept()
      Queries to the OWL representation for the equivalent classes of this class.
      default java.util.List<Semantic.MappingIntent> readSemantic()
      This method is used to synchronise specific Semantic.Axioms (or Semantic.SemanticAxioms) from the ontology.
      default Semantic.Axioms.SynchronisationIntent<J> synchroniseEquivalentConceptFromSemantic()
      It calls Semantic.Axioms#synchroniseFrom(Axioms) with queryEquivalentConcept() as input parameter.
      default Semantic.Axioms.SynchronisationIntent<J> synchroniseEquivalentConceptToSemantic()
      It calls Semantic.Axioms#synchroniseTo(Axioms) with queryEquivalentConcept() as input parameter.

    • Method Detail

      • readSemantic

        default java.util.List<Semantic.MappingIntent> readSemantic()
        Description copied from interface: Semantic.Descriptor
        This method is used to synchronise specific Semantic.Axioms (or Semantic.SemanticAxioms) from the ontology. It manipulates the OWLLOOP representation to be equal to the queried OWL structure. It is based on Axioms#synchroniseFrom(Axioms).
        Specified by:
        readSemantic in interface Semantic.Descriptor<O,J>
        Returns:
        the changes made in the Semantic.Axioms during the reading. Those objects may not have the Semantic.MappingIntent.getOntologyChanges() field initialised (i.e.: Void).

      • buildEquivalentConcept

        default java.util.Set<D> buildEquivalentConcept()
        Create an Semantic.Descriptor set where each element represents the classes equivalent to this Concept. Each of those Concepts are instantiated through the method getNewEquivalentConcept(Object, Object); this is called for all getEquivalentConcept().
        Returns:
        the set of Concepts that describes the entities equivalent to this described ontological class.

      • getNewEquivalentConcept

        D getNewEquivalentConcept(J instance,
                          O ontology)
        This method is called by buildEquivalentConcept() and its purpose is to instantiate a new Concept to represent an class equivalent from this Concept Descriptor.
        Parameters:
        instance - the instance to ground the new Concept.
        ontology - the ontology in which ground the new Concept.
        Returns:
        a new Semantic.Descriptor for all the classes equivalent to this descriptor.

      • getEquivalentConcept

        Semantic.Axioms<J> getEquivalentConcept()
        Returns the Semantic.Axioms that describes all the equivalent classes of this Concept from a no OOP point of view.
        Returns:
        the entities describing the equivalent classes to this object

      • queryEquivalentConcept

        Semantic.Axioms<J> queryEquivalentConcept()
        Queries to the OWL representation for the equivalent classes of this class.
        Returns:
        a new Semantic.Axioms contained the equivalent classes to the OWL structure of Semantic.Descriptor.getInstance().

      • synchroniseEquivalentConceptToSemantic

        default Semantic.Axioms.SynchronisationIntent<J> synchroniseEquivalentConceptToSemantic()
        It calls Semantic.Axioms#synchroniseTo(Axioms) with queryEquivalentConcept() as input parameter. This computes the changes to be performed in the OWL representation for synchronise it with respect to getEquivalentConcept(). This should be done by Semantic.Descriptor.writeSemantic().
        Returns:
        the changes to be done to synchronise this structure with the equivalent classes of an OWL class.

      • synchroniseEquivalentConceptFromSemantic

        default Semantic.Axioms.SynchronisationIntent<J> synchroniseEquivalentConceptFromSemantic()
        It calls Semantic.Axioms#synchroniseFrom(Axioms) with queryEquivalentConcept() as input parameter. This computes the changes to be performed into the getEquivalentConcept() in order to synchronise it with respect to an OWL representation. This is be done by readSemantic().
        Returns:
        the changes to be done to synchronise the equivalent classes of an OWL class with this structure.
